page.title: 10Jacob Cowans at Dalston
page.content: Jacob Cowens is a factory in Dalston making cotton wool products.It employs 42 people.Two thirds of the number employed at the factory come from Dalston.Raw products are delivered from Britain,Greece and China.The finshed products made include cotton wool balls,shoulder pads,duvet fillings and gas mask filters.These products are sold in Britain but also exported to Chile,Greece and Middle East countries.The chief transport used is lorries.In the factory the machines are powered by electricity. The manager of the cotton mill now is Mr Coulthard who has been there for along time.There are many traces of history including the original mill race,water wheel,spindle and old buildings.Some of the original buildings are now let and used by Norflex.Which makes (see page 20)
